Model

Interface ICalendar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Calendar

    public interface ICalendar
    A calendar has only one possible action: buildCalendar, which allows to show the calendar given by the month and year the user inputs.
    Author:
    Octavio Maia

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String buildCalendar()
      Main function which builds the calendar and appends it to a string.
      int day()
      Calculates the first day of the month.
      boolean isLeapYear()
      A calendar has only one possible action: buildCalendar, which allows to show the calendar given by the month and year the user inputs.
      void setMonth(int month)
      Sets the month to the value the user has given in the input.
      void setYear(int year)
      Sets the year to the value the user has given in the input.

    • Method Detail

      • day

        int day()
        Calculates the first day of the month. (e.g: Monday, Tuesday, ... , Sunday)
        Returns:
        number of the day (1-7).

      • isLeapYear

        boolean isLeapYear()
        A calendar has only one possible action: buildCalendar, which allows to show the calendar given by the month and year the user inputs.

      • buildCalendar

        java.lang.String buildCalendar()
        Main function which builds the calendar and appends it to a string.
        Returns:
        String containing the calendar.

      • setYear

        void setYear(int year)
        Sets the year to the value the user has given in the input.
        Parameters:
        year - year read by the input handler.

      • setMonth

        void setMonth(int month)
        Sets the month to the value the user has given in the input.
        Parameters:
        month - month read by the input handler.
